required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: How Does Prostate Cancer Metastasize? Studying the Role of Secreted Packages (Exosomes) From Fat Tissue in Lean and Obese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The EXOPRO Study: How Does Prostate Cancer Metastasize? Understanding the Role of Exosomal Communication in Lean vs Obese Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will be collecting prostate and fat tissue from participants undergoing radical prostatectomy to culture and study in the laboratory.

detailed_description.textblock: Both obesity and prostate cancer are major health problems in the UK, affecting 1 in 3 and 1 in 8 men respectively. Moreover, obesity increases the risk of developing aggressive disease and the risk of prostate cancer spreading. How this happens is not known. The investigators want to understand how fat cells communicate with prostate cancer cells. Investigators will be collecting prostate and fat tissue from radical prostatectomy participants for culture, in particular to look at exosome communication.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine functional differences of peri-prostatic adipose tissue from lean vs obese patients on prostate cancer cell lines
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through to study completion, on average 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Proliferation, migration, invasion, apoptosis and epthelial-mesenchymal transition assays will be performed using isolated exosomes on prostate cancer cell lines

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of exosomal small RNAs transferred between human adipose tissue to prostate cancer cells lines
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through to study completion, on average 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Exosomal RNA transferred from human adipose tissue to prostate cancer cell lines will be isolated using a tagged magnetic bead isolation method and sequenced to identify transferred small RNAs

primary_outcome.measure: Assess how exosomal small RNAs from lean vs obese patients affect cancer regulation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through to study completion, on average 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Prostate cancer cell lines will be treated with isolated exosomes, then parental and treated cells sequenced to identify differentially expressed RNA and underlying changes

primary_outcome.measure: Attempt to replicate functional changes observed
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through to study completion, on average 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Treatment of prostate cancer cell lines with microRNA mimics or inhibitors and comparison of changes with exosome treated cell lines

biospec_descr.textblock: Prostate cancer tissue, benign prostate tissue, peri-prostatic adipose tissue, omental adipose tissue, blood, urine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All men undergoing radical prostatectomy at Charing Cross Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unable to consent

eligibility.gender_description: Biological male only (can include transgender women)

facility.name: Charing Cross Hospital, Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data for all primary and secondary outcomes will be made available.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available within 6 to 12 months of study completion.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by an external independent review panel. Regulators will be required to sign a data access agreement.
